snippet: The government of Ecuador, led by socialist president Rafael Correa, has invested $500,000 in Runa, which makes tea from the Ecuadorian guayusa leaf.
abstract: The government of Ecuador, led by socialist president Rafael Correa, has invested $500,000 in Runa, which makes tea from the Ecuadorian guayusa leaf.
lead_paragraph: Forget its mild-mannered reputation: tea is not for the faint of heart.  Last year, the United States tea industry brought in $6.5 billion thanks to a roster of heavy hitting, fiercely competitive brands, ranging from Honest Tea to Tazo and old-time stalwarts like Lipton.

headline.main: A Brooklyn Tea Company Backed by a Socialist President

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: United States Agency for International Development
